Issues.Title: WIP: Porting FormatStringEditor
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #2281
Related issue #1115 
Related PR #2287


## Proposed changes

- Port FormatStringEditor 
- Make code refactoring
- Add TypeForwardedTo statement for FormatStringEditor 
- Add unit tests cases

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Changed FormatStringEditor editor to compliance with .Net 4.8.

## Regression? 

- Yes 

## Risk

- Low

- CTI

     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible.

Issues.Title: Porting several outstanding `UITypeEditor`s
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Contributes to #1115


## Proposed changes

- Porting several outstanding `UITypeEditor`s
	* `ImageIndexEditor` (Closes #2115)
	* `IconEditor` (Closes #2020)
	* `TabPageCollectionEditor` (Closes #1281)
	* `ContentAlignmentEditor` (Closes #2018)
	* `ListControlStringCollectionEditor` (Closes #1271)
	* `BinaryEditor` (Closes #2017)
	* `DateTimeEditor`  (Closes #2019)
	* `ListViewSubItemCollectionEditor` (Closes #1277)
	* `ListViewGroupCollectionEditor` (Closes #1275)
	* `ListViewItemCollectionEditor` (Closes #1276)
- Add test scaffolds for UITypeEditors
	* Add editors we missed to the table of intrinsic editors
	* Add positive ack test for editors associated in the table
	* Add entries in test for editors only attached with editor attribute
	* Add editor type to editor test and create basic test for properties
	* Add stubs for all known editors requiring porting
- Partially revert "Porting DataMemberFieldConverter"  f477b2a
Whilst we do not support nor cant be expected to support customers who reference our internals, in some scenarios like `UITypeEditor`s and `TypeConverter`s may still be used by consumers to enhance their runtime experience.
E.g. https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2078#discussion_r337777751
Type forward `DataMemberFieldConverter` to avoid breaking existing customers.

Relates to #1545

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Customers should have access to more UITypeEditors at runtime if they use `PropertyGrid` control. 
NB: The VS Desginer has its own set of editors.


## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual
- CTI 



###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2288)
